description: The .env file uses development environment variable naming (APPLICATION_NAME, DATABASE_HOST, CACHE_URL, etc.) but app_config.py expects production naming (APP_NAME, DB_HOST, REDIS_URL, etc.), causing KeyErrors when trying to load required environment variables.
error_message: KeyError: 'Required environment variable not found: APP_NAME'
expected_fix: Update app_config.py to use the development environment variable names from env_schema.py: change 'APP_NAME' to 'APPLICATION_NAME', 'APP_VERSION' to 'APPLICATION_VERSION', 'DB_HOST' to 'DATABASE_HOST', 'DB_PORT' to 'DATABASE_PORT', 'DB_NAME' to 'DATABASE_NAME', 'DB_USER' to 'DATABASE_USER', 'DB_PASSWORD' to 'DATABASE_PASSWORD', 'REDIS_URL' to 'CACHE_URL', 'API_KEY' to 'API_SECRET_KEY', 'SECRET_KEY' to 'APP_SECRET', 'LOG_LEVEL' to 'LOGGING_LEVEL'.
complexity_factors: Need to compare .env file against app_config.py to find mismatches
Multiple environment variable names need updating (11 total)
env_schema.py shows both production and development schemas for reference
All env var names in load_config() method need to be changed
Need to understand the naming convention difference between environments
optimal_fix: In app_config.py load_config() method, replace all env.require() calls with development variable names: APP_NAME->APPLICATION_NAME, APP_VERSION->APPLICATION_VERSION, DB_HOST->DATABASE_HOST, DB_PORT->DATABASE_PORT, DB_NAME->DATABASE_NAME, DB_USER->DATABASE_USER, DB_PASSWORD->DATABASE_PASSWORD, REDIS_URL->CACHE_URL, API_KEY->API_SECRET_KEY, SECRET_KEY->APP_SECRET, LOG_LEVEL->LOGGING_LEVEL.
